creator: jonoandvicki
content:
Fora number of weeks, i have been unable to send emails. The problem just appeared suddenly and does not appear related to any updates or my security settings. When trying to send, i get an error message: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <unknown{202.172.111.110}>: Client host rejected: Access denied. Please check the message recipient "xxx@xxx.com" and try again."

I have seen others with the same issue, but no replies with a fix. Thanks

title: Changed e-mail provider and now can't access old emails
creator: filmona
content:
I have changed web hosting provider and now have new IMAP/SMTP server details (same e-mail address "user@domain.com"). I have created a new e-mail account in Thunderbird Beta with the new details and this works fine.

However, the existing e-mail account for "user@domain.com" which is using the old IMAP/SMTP details has thousands of e-mails previously downloaded. Some of these e-mails are still readable in Thunderbird Beta but the majority now say "Go Online to View This Message" in the preview pane. I no longer have access the the old web host.

If I look in the profile directory for this account, it looks like the e-mail is there. Is there a way of copying these e-mails to the new e-mail account?

Many thanks

content:

I have been using Tbird for 10 years and really like the program. I am having to start using Outlook, which I dislike. title: Text size when reading or composing messages
creator: ronniebolling
content: Hi, I'm using TB version 128, been a TB user for many years and contribute money regulaly to TB since I love the software and see it as valuable. But trying to use it on my laptop that I bought over a year ago with a hi-resolution monitor is frustrating. I've read all the related posts here about how to "fix" this as well as anything I could find online, tried all the settings in TB, but nothing fixes my issue, nor does it for the many, many other users I'm hearing from as I read online about this far too common problem. When I read a new message all is well as far as the size of the text, but when I reply the font is reduced to an unreadable size unless you have the eyes of Superman. Same thing happens when I compose a new message. On each and every message, I have to repeatedly use the CTRL + keys to increase the text size. I have changed the default setting in layout.css.devPixelsPerPx to 1.5, and that helps with the general interface, but has zero effect on the text size issue. I have also tried every "fix" listed in this support site as well as many others (Reddit, etc.), and nothing will fix this annoying issue. I want to compose or read ALL my messages in the same readable text size, and I can't believe that Thunderbird's developers can't correct this simple problem. Does anyone have any idea how to set the default text and get it to "stick" vs reverting to tiny text?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:133.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/133.0
